title: 109_hr481
content:
The Act is titled the "Sand Creek Massacre National Historic Site Trust Act of 2005" and includes definitions for various terms used within the Act. The Act, titled the "Sand Creek Massacre National Historic Site Trust Act of 2005," defines key terms such as facility, improvement, Secretary, and Tribe. It includes structures like a ranch house, shop building, livestock corral, and water/wastewater systems on trust property. The "Sand Creek Massacre National Historic Site Trust Act of 2005" defines trust property as the Dawson Ranch in Kiowa County, Colorado, consisting of approximately 1,465 acres under the jurisdiction of the Tribes of Oklahoma. It includes specific sections of land within the sixth principal meridian. The "Sand Creek Massacre National Historic Site Trust Act of 2005" conveys land to be held in trust for the Cheyenne and Arapaho Tribes of Oklahoma. The trust property will be held for the benefit of the Tribe without further action by the Secretary. All rights of the United States in the trust property, except for facilities constructed under section 4(b), are held in trust for the Tribe. SEC. 4. IMPROVEMENTS AND FACILITIES.

The Secretary may acquire improvements in fee by donation. Facilities can be constructed on trust property after consulting and obtaining agreement from the Tribes. Facilities built with Federal funds will be owned by the United States. Federal funds can only be used on facilities owned by the United States.

SEC. 5. SURVEY OF BOUNDARY LINE; PUBLICATION OF DESCRIPTION. SEC. 5. SURVEY OF BOUNDARY LINE; PUBLICATION OF DESCRIPTION.

To establish the trust property boundary accurately, the Secretary will conduct a survey within 180 days. The full description of the boundary lines will be published in the Federal Register upon completion and acceptance by the Tribe representatives, becoming the official description of the trust property. The trust property at the Sand Creek Massacre National Historic Site is to be administered by the Secretary in perpetuity for historical, traditional, and cultural uses. The Secretary has access to the property for management purposes and must ensure it is used in accordance with the law. Savings Provision: This Act does not override laws and policies governing National Park System units. SEC. 7. ACQUISITION OF PROPERTY. Amends the Sand Creek Massacre National Historic Site Establishment Act to allow acquisition of property by donation or exchange.
